channel.title: The Hon. Chris Christie
channel.description: The Hon. Chris Christie Governor of New Jersey (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: This stage and this moment are very improbable for me.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: A New Jersey Republican delivering the keynote address to our national convention, from a state with 700,000 more Democrats than Republicans.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: A New Jersey Republican stands before you tonight.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Proud of my party, proud of my state and proud of my country.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I am the son of an Irish father and a Sicilian mother.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: My Dad, who I am blessed to have with me here tonight, is gregarious, outgoing and loveable.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: My Mom, who I lost 8 years ago, was the enforcer. She made sure we all knew who set the rules.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: In the automobile of life, Dad was just a passenger. Mom was the driver.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They both lived hard lives. Dad grew up in poverty. After returning from Army service, he worked at the Breyers Ice Cream plant in the 1950s. With that job and the G.I. bill he put himself through Rutgers University at night to become the first in his family to earn a college degree. Our first family picture was on his graduation day, with Mom beaming next to him, six months pregnant with me.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Mom also came from nothing. She was raised by a single mother who took three buses to get to work every day. And mom spent the time she was supposed to be a kid actually raising children ­ her two younger siblings. She was tough as nails and didn't suffer fools at all. The truth was she couldn't afford to. She spoke the truth ­ bluntly, directly and without much varnish.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I am her son.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I was her son as I listened to "Darkness on the Edge of Town" with my high school friends on the Jersey Shore.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I was her son as I moved into a studio apartment with Mary Pat to start a marriage that is now 26 years old.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I was her son as I coached our sons Andrew and Patrick on the fields of Mendham, and as I watched with pride as our daughters Sarah and Bridget marched with their soccer teams in the Labor Day parade.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: And I am still her son today, as Governor, following the rules she taught me: to speak from the heart and to fight for your principles. She never thought you get extra credit for just speaking the truth.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: The greatest lesson Mom ever taught me, though, was this one: she told me there would be times in your life when you have to choose between being loved and being respected. She said to always pick being respected, that love without respect was always fleeting -- but that respect could grow into real, lasting love.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Now, of course, she was talking about women.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: But I have learned over time that it applies just as much to leadership. In fact, I think that advice applies to America today more than ever.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I believe we have become paralyzed by our desire to be loved.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity is fleeting and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and emotions of the times.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Our leaders today have decided it is more important to be popular, to do what is easy and say "yes," rather than to say no when "no" is what's required.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: In recent years, we as a country have too often chosen the same path.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's been easy for our leaders to say not us, and not now, in taking on the tough issues. And we've stood silently by and let them get away with it.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: But tonight, I say enough.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I say, together, let's make a much different choice. Tonight, we are speaking up for ourselves and stepping up.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We are beginning to do what is right and what is necessary to make our country great again.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We are demanding that our leaders stop tearing each other down, and work together to take action on the big things facing America.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Tonight, we choose respect over love.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We are not afraid. We are taking our country back.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We are the great grandchildren of men and women who broke their backs in the name of American ingenuity; the grandchildren of the Greatest Generation; the sons and daughters of immigrants; the brothers and sisters of everyday heroes; the neighbors of entrepreneurs and firefighters, teachers and farmers, veterans and factory workers and everyone in-between who shows up not just on the big days or the good days, but on the bad days and on the hard days.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Each and every day. All 365 of them.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We are the United States of America.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Now we must lead the way our citizens live. To lead as my mother insisted I live, not by avoiding truths, especially the hard ones, but by facing up to them and being the better for it.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We cannot afford to do anything less.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I know because this was the challenge in New Jersey.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: When I came into office, I could continue on the same path that led to wealth, jobs and people leaving the state or I could do the job the people elected me to do ­ to do the big things.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: There were those who said it couldn't be done. The problems were too big, too politically charged, too broken to fix. But we were on a path we could no longer afford to follow.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They said it was impossible to cut taxes in a state where taxes were raised 115 times in eight years. That it was impossible to balance a budget at the same time, with an $11 billion deficit.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Three years later, we have three balanced budgets with lower taxes.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We did it.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They said it was impossible to touch the third rail of politics. To take on the public sector unions and to reform a pension and health benefit system that was headed to bankruptcy.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: With bipartisan leadership we saved taxpayers $132 billion over 30 years and saved retirees their pension.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We did it.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They said it was impossible to speak the truth to the teachers union. They were just too powerful.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Real teacher tenure reform that demands accountability and ends the guarantee of a job for life regardless of performance would never happen.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: For the first time in 100 years with bipartisan support, we did it.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: The disciples of yesterday's politics underestimated the will of the people. They assumed our people were selfish; that when told of the difficult problems, tough choices and complicated solutions, they would simply turn their backs, that they would decide it was every man for himself.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Instead, the people of New Jersey stepped up and shared in the sacrifice.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They rewarded politicians who led instead of politicians who pandered.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We shouldn't be surprised.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We've never been a country to shy away from the truth. History shows that we stand up when it counts and it's this quality that has defined our character and our significance in the world.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I know this simple truth and I'm not afraid to say it: our ideas are right for America and their ideas have failed America.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Let's be clear with the American people tonight. Here's what we believe as Republicans and what they believe as Democrats.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe in telling hard working families the truth about our country's fiscal realities. Telling them what they already know ­ the math of federal spending doesn't add up.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: With $5 trillion in debt added over the last four years, we have no other option but to make the hard choices, cut federal spending and fundamentally reduce the size of government.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe that the American people don't want to hear the truth about the extent of our fiscal difficulties and need to be coddled by big government.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe the American people are content to live the lie with them.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe in telling seniors the truth about our overburdened entitlements.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We know seniors not only want these programs to survive, but they just as badly want them secured for their grandchildren.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Seniors are not selfish.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe seniors will always put themselves ahead of their grandchildren. So they prey on their vulnerabilities and scare them with misinformation for the cynical purpose of winning the next election.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Their plan: whistle a happy tune while driving us off the fiscal cliff, as long as they are behind the wheel of power.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe that the majority of teachers in America know our system must be reformed to put students first so that America can compete.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Teachers don't teach to become rich or famous. They teach because they love children.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe that we should honor and reward the good ones while doing what's best for our nation's future ­ demanding accountability, higher standards and the best teacher in every classroom.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe the educational establishment will always put themselves ahead of children. That self-interest trumps common sense.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe in pitting unions against teachers, educators against parents, and lobbyists against children.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: They believe in teacher's unions.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe in teachers.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe that if we tell the people the truth they will act bigger than the pettiness of Washington, D.C.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We believe it's possible to forge bipartisan compromise and stand up for conservative principles.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's the power of our ideas, not of our rhetoric, that attracts people to our Party.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We win when we make it about what needs to be done; we lose when we play along with their game of scaring and dividing.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: For make no mistake, the problems are too big to let the American people lose ­ the slowest economic recovery in decades, a spiraling out of control deficit, an education system that's failing to compete in the world.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It doesn't matter how we got here. There is enough blame to go around.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: What matters now is what we do.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I know we can fix our problems.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: When there are people in the room who care more about doing the job they were elected to do than worrying about winning re-election, it's possible to work together, achieve principled compromise and get results.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: The people have no patience for any other way.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's simple.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We need politicians to care more about doing something and less about being something.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Believe me, if we can do this in a blue state with a conservative Republican Governor, Washington is out of excuses.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Leadership delivers.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Leadership counts.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Leadership matters.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We have this leader for America.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We have a nominee who will tell us the truth and who will lead with conviction. And now he has a running mate who will do the same.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We have Governor Mitt Romney and Congressman Paul Ryan, and we must make them our next President and Vice President.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Mitt Romney will tell us the hard truths we need to hear to put us back on the path to growth and create good paying private sector jobs again in America.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Mitt Romney will tell us the hard truths we need to hear to end the torrent of debt that is compromising our future and burying our economy.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Mitt Romney will tell us the hard truths we need to hear to end the debacle of putting the world's greatest health care system in the hands of federal bureaucrats and putting those bureaucrats between an American citizen and her doctor.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We ended an era of absentee leadership without purpose or principle in New Jersey.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's time to end this era of absentee leadership in the Oval Office and send real leaders to the White House.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: America needs Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan and we need them right now.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: There is doubt and fear for our future in every corner of our country.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: These feelings are real.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: This moment is real.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's a moment like this where some skeptics wonder if American greatness is over.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: How those who have come before us had the spirit and tenacity to lead America to a new era of greatness in the face of challenge.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Not to look around and say "not me," but to say, "YES, ME." I have an answer tonight for the skeptics and the naysayers, the dividers and the defenders of the status quo.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I have faith in us.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I know we can be the men and women our country calls on us to be.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I believe in America and her history.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: There's only one thing missing now. Leadership. It takes leadership that you don't get from reading a poll.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: You see, Mr. President ­ real leaders don't follow polls. Real leaders change polls.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: That's what we need to do now.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Change polls through the power of our principles.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Change polls through the strength of our convictions.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Tonight, our duty is to tell the American people the truth.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Our problems are big and the solutions will not be painless. We all must share in the sacrifice.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Any leader that tells us differently is simply not telling the truth.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I think tonight of the Greatest Generation.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We look back and marvel at their courage ­ overcoming the Great Depression, fighting Nazi tyranny, standing up for freedom around the world.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Now it's our time to answer history's call.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: For make no mistake, every generation will be judged and so will we.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: What will our children and grandchildren say of us? Will they say we buried our heads in the sand, we assuaged ourselves with the creature comforts we've acquired, that our problems were too big and we were too small, that someone else should make a difference because we can't? Or will they say we stood up and made the tough choices needed to preserve our way of life? I don't know about you, but I don't want my children and grandchildren to have to read in a history book what it was like to live in an American Century.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I don't want their only inheritance to be an enormous government that has overtaxed, overspent and over-borrowed a great people into second-class citizenship.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I want them to live in a second American Century.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: A second American Century of strong economic growth where those who are willing to work hard will have good paying jobs to support their families and reach their dreams.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: A second American Century where real American exceptionalism is not a political punch line, but is evident to everyone in the world just by watching the way our government conducts its business and everyday Americans live their lives.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: A second American Century where our military is strong, our values are sure, our work ethic is unmatched and our Constitution remains a model for anyone in the world struggling for liberty.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Let us choose a path that will be remembered for generations to come. Standing strong for freedom will make the next century as great an American century as the last one.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: This is the American way.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We have never been victims of destiny.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: We have always been masters of our own.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: I won't be part of the generation that fails that test and neither will you.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: It's now time to stand up. There's no time left to waste.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: If you're willing to stand up with me for America's future, I will stand up with you.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: If you're willing to fight with me for Mitt Romney, I will fight with you.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: If you're willing to hear the truth about the hard road ahead, and the rewards for America that truth will bear, I'm here to begin with you this new era of truth-telling.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Tonight, we choose the path that has always defined our nation's history.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Tonight, we finally and firmly answer the call that so many generations have had the courage to answer before us.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: Tonight, we stand up for Mitt Romney as the next President of the United States.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie

item.title: And, together, we stand up once again for American greatness.
item.author: The Hon. Chris Christie
